message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.SE, cs.SI, cs.DC

The paper discusses a covert channel for leaking sensitive information from air-gapped computers through manipulations on the screen brightness. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it involves a potential attack on a computer system. Additionally, the paper discusses the technical and scientific background of the covert channel, which could fall under human-computer interaction (cs.HC), software engineering (cs.SE), and social and information networks (cs.SI). Lastly, the paper presents relevant countermeasures to this type of attack, which could fall under distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
